🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

To Everyone Facing Job Rejections – Keep Going! 💪If you’re tired of applying, waiting, and hearing "We regret to inform you…" – you’re not alone. 🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

This is really true. Most of the profiles looking by companies are nothing more, nothing less than wish lists. Of couse they looking by candidates that can match so much as possible the requirements asked for the role or job, but sometimes, what can be a game changer is your attitude or behaviour in an interview in front of the interviewer especially if that person is the team leader or the responsible by the position. One of the questions that you should be prepared to answer is why do you think you are able to work for that position. Things like understanding the culture and values of a company are important too.

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity



…more

🔁 𝗗𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗧𝘄𝗼-𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗲𝘁Let’s talk about fairness, empathy, and long-term thinking in recruitment.🛑 If a candidate has a 3-month notice period, don’t expect them to join immediately.🛑 If your organization struggles with retention beyond 3 months, don’t grill candidates for frequent job switches.🛑 If you put 5 candidates on hold waiting for "the perfect one," don’t be surprised when the "perfect one" has 5 offers and chooses a better fit.💡 Here’s what candidates truly value:Timely feedback—not just silence after an interview.Constructive rejection—help them grow, even if it’s a no.Empathy—especially for those navigating layoffs or gaps.Because here’s the truth:📌 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙧𝙚𝙟𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖 𝙣𝙚𝙬 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙤𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙤𝙬.But what they’ll remember is how you treated them when they were vulnerable.Next year, they might be the hiring manager reviewing your profile or the gatekeeper to a referral you want.🤝 Let’s build a talent ecosystem grounded in respect, not just requirements.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#HR hashtag#HiringEthics hashtag#EmpathyInHiring hashtag#Careers hashtag#HumanResources hashtag#JobSearch

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

Why I Believe Saviynt Will Surpass SailPoint Identity Security Cloud as the Leading Cloud Identity Solution:As someone who has been part of both Saviynt and SailPoint Identity Security Cloud implementations, I’ve seen firsthand the challenges and advantages of each platform. While both are positioned as cloud identity solutions, Saviynt's low-code/no-code approach gives it a decisive edge. Here’s why:✅ Lower Skill Barrier & Hiring Costs: SailPoint Identity Security Cloud still requires engineers with strong programming skills (Java, BeanShell, etc.), making implementations dependent on highly specialized talent. Finding and hiring such resources is expensive, and the learning curve is steep. Saviynt, on the other hand, leverages low-code/no-code configurations, reducing reliance on hard-to-find developers and making it easier for IAM teams to manage without deep coding expertise.✅ Simplified Deployment & Faster Time-to-Value: Saviynt’s low-code UI-driven workflows significantly reduce deployment complexity compared to SailPoint Identity Security Cloud, where custom rules and scripts can add time and effort. This means businesses can get up and running faster, with fewer headaches, and lower implementation costs.✅ Cost Efficiency & Scalability: With Saviynt’s low-code approach, companies spend less on implementation and ongoing maintenance. Fewer specialized developers are required, reducing overall costs. This makes it a more scalable and cost-effective solution, especially for enterprises looking to optimize IAM operations without inflating their budgets.✅ Reduced Complexity & Operational Overhead: The more custom code an IAM solution requires, the harder it becomes to maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot. SailPoint Identity Security Cloud’s reliance on custom scripting adds complexity, while Saviynt’s configuration-driven model ensures easier updates, better maintainability, and fewer breakpoints over time.At the end of the day, the IAM space is shifting toward simplified, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. While SailPoint Identity Security Cloud remains a strong player, the demand for low-code/no-code identity management is growing—and that’s exactly why Saviynt is set to overtake it in the cloud IAM space.Would love to hear your thoughts! Is low-code/no-code the future of IAM?🚀 hashtag#IAM hashtag#CloudSecurity hashtag#Saviynt hashtag#SailPointIdentitySecurityCloud hashtag#Cybersecurity

I recently explored Hiredly, a job platform in Malaysia. Hiredly platform is a simple website, well organized and easy to navigate. It’s easy to search for jobs with filters like job type, company and skills. Hiredly offer lots of job types such as full-time jobs, part time jobs, internships, and even remote working jobs. Hiredly have features where user can upload their CV for instant job matches. They also offers a Work Personality Test which can help users in discovering jobs that suitable with their strengths and work style. Additionally, AI generated summary to let user know about the job. Hiredly specifically targets Gen Y and Z, suitable for fresh graduates and experienced workers. What’s great about this Hiredly job platform is user-friendly design, have a detail about the job such as job description, job requirements and company benefits. Unfortunately, their platform has some limitations like some jobs don’t provide salary details. Hiredly should introduce features like salary insights and career advice which can enhance the user experience.hashtag#ULE2342 hashtag#EPC
